abstract: Richard Greenfield of Pali Research conceded the film’s success, but maintained a sell recommendation on Disney shares.
snippet: Richard Greenfield of Pali Research conceded the film’s success, but maintained a sell recommendation on Disney shares.
lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES  A mea culpa, of a sort, came Wednesday from the Wall Street analyst who was the most prominent (but not the lone) prerelease naysayer about “Up,” the Disney-Pixar movie that over the weekend became the studio’s second-highest grossing film ever in North America, after “Finding Nemo.”

headline.main: Analyst Admits to Being ‘Dead Wrong’ After Disney’s ‘Up’ Is Big Earner
headline.print_headline: Analyst Admits to Being ‘Dead Wrong’ After Disney’s ‘Up’ Is Big Earner
